item.title: small wins, dopamine hits, and documenting 2022 [keeps updating]
item.description: This list is a documentation of all the things that made me happy in 2022 — the small wins that keep me moving. This is not to show off but to bring a sense of gratitude in finding comfort in the smaller things. I have good days and I have bad days and on my bad days, there is comfort in knowing that this is something I can come to.

item.title: my favourite reads, tools, and other random things on the internet [keeps updating]
item.description: The following is a non-exhaustive gratitude list [keeps updating] of all my favourite reads, websites, tools, and any other random thing I’ve found on the internet that has helped me make my life better. [last updated on Dec 29, 2021] reads The Theory of Cumulative Stress: How to Recover When Stress Builds — James Clear → great read about how stress builds up and how you can fight back Landing at Razorpay — Manan Agarwal → fantastic read about hard work, humility, and trusting the process Rules — Aditya Mohanty → this read is what inspired me to define rules for my own life From Fool To Cool: How To Stay Calm, No Matter What — Bruce Kasanoff → fascinating read about staying calm Lines, not dots — Manas Saloi → a great post (as always from Manas) about building professional relationships Tonkin’s Model of Grief — Lois Tonkin → a read about Tonkin’s Model of Grief 100 Simple Truths — traf → the cut-throat truth laid down Stonks Simplified → a fascinating newsletter series by my friend Ishaan , fantastic for beginners looking to understand the stock market The Glorious Freedom of Disabling Read Receipts → the article that convinced me to disable my read receipts (was highly reluctant, having kept them on ever since I started using messaging apps) How Slack Became the Fastest Growing B2B SaaS Business Ever → incredible article explaining the brilliance behind Slack tools Markdown New Tab → love using this for my new tabs, easy to jot down to-dos, reminders, etc Visualize Value → when I’m not using Markdown New Tab, Visualize Value is my go to extension for new tabs.

item.title: rules, why I need them, and why I'm writing them down [keeps updating]
item.description: A while ago, I stumbled across Aditya Mohanty’s blog and saw this — a collection of rules that he lives by. Being someone that loves defining every aspect of my life and committing to a certain standard of ethics, I decided to make a list of rules for myself as well. To save your time, I’ve listed my rules first, the chit-chat comes later. Rules [last updated on Dec 16, 2021]
